net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl.shader

Class Shader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl.shader.Shader

  • public class Shader
extends java.lang.Object
    Classed use to create an Object-Oriented way to access the functionality of an OpenGL shader.
    Since:
    Apr 26, 2013 at 11:11:41 PM, v0.1
    Version:
    Jul 2, 2013 at 12:41:39 PM, v0.2
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Method Detail

      • loadFromSource

        public void loadFromSource(java.lang.String[] vertexShaderSources,
                  java.lang.String[] fragmentShaderSources)
        Load the Shader from a String array. The first group of Strings is for the sources of the vertex shaders. The next group of Strings is for the sources of the fragment shaders.
        Parameters:
        vertexShaderSources - The array of Strings that hold the source for each of the vertex shaders.
        fragmentShaderSources - The array of Strings that hold the source for each of the fragment shaders.

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile(java.lang.String[] vertexShaderLocations,
                java.lang.String[] fragmentShaderLocations)
        Load a Shader from some Files located at the locations given by the String arrays.
        Parameters:
        vertexShaderLocations - The String array containing the locations of each of the Vertex Shaders to load.
        fragmentShaderLocations - The String array containing the locations of each of the Fragment Shaders to load.

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile(java.lang.String parentDir,
                java.lang.String[] vertexShaderLocations,
                java.lang.String[] fragmentShaderLocations)
        Load a Shader from some Files located at the locations given by the String arrays. Each of the Strings in the arrays will be modified to start with the parentDir String given.

        For example:
        loadFile("C:/shaders", new String[] { "vert.vs" }, new String[] { "frag.fs" });
        will load the shaders "vert.vs" and "frag.fs" from the folder located at "C:/shaders"
        Parameters:
        parentDir - The directory to locate the shaders relative from.
        vertexShaderLocations - The String array containing the locations of each of the Vertex Shaders to load.
        fragmentShaderLocations - The String array containing the locations of each of the Fragment Shaders to load.

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the Shader's files.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop using the Shader.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Delete the Shader program from the memory.

      • getUniformLocation

        public int getUniformLocation(int programId,
                     java.lang.String uniformName)
        Get the location, according to OpenGL, of the uniform with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        programId - The Shader Program to search for the uniform from.
        uniformName - The variable name of the uniform you want to get.
        Returns:
        The id number of the uniform according to OpenGL.

      • uniform4i

        public void uniform4i(int uniformLocation,
             int x,
             int y,
             int z,
             int w)
        Set the integer value of the uniform vec4 variable with at the specified location within the Shader.
        Parameters:
        uniformLocation - The location assigned to the variable by the OpenGL Shader program.
        x - The first value to set in the vec4.
        y - The second value to set in the vec4.
        z - The third value to set in the vec4.
        w - The fourth value to set in the vec4.

      • uniform4i

        Set the double value of the attrib vec3 variable with the specified name in the Shader.
        Parameters:
        attribLocation - The name of the attrib variable that is to be set.
        x - The first value to set in the vec3.
        y - The second value to set in the vec3.
        z - The third value to set in the vec3.

      • vertexAttrib2d

                  double x,
                  double y)

        Parameters:

        x - The first value to set in the vec2.
        y - The second value to set in the vec2.
